trial_identification.studytitle: The effects of a newly designed stepwise functional appliance on growth and development in Class II mandibular deficient patients.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effects on growth and development of a newly designed stepwise functional appliance in Class II mandibular deficient patients.

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: The device is a functional applicance made from a stainless steel casing and acrylic which houses a small magnet. The device is cemented onto the occlusal surfaces of the posterior teeth and with the use of magnetic forces moves the lower jaw forward. The amount of movment of the jaw is determined by another magnetic plate which is designed so that the magnet is placed at 3mm intervals which will act to move the lower jaw forward in 3mm incremental steps. The device is worn in the mouth for 9 months.
interventions.comparator:
No treatment control group and twin block control group as assessed by two other studies.
No other functional appliance is used in the study, only information from other studies previously done is used.
The source of the historical data is several published journal articles and they range in time from 1980 to 2010

primaryOutcome.outcome: Reduced overjet and protrusion of the mandible within normal limits as assessed by cephalometric measurements, 3DMD photography and other radiographic evidence.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1. Aged between 12 and 14. 2. Have a Class II dental and skeletal relationship with mandibular deficiency 3. Decreased lower facial height 4. Permanent dentition 5. No severe posterior crowding 6. No previous orthodontic treatment, trauma and no dental or congenital anomalies 7. Good oral hygiene and no periodontal disease.

trial_design.concealment: Patients are selected randomly from the computerised waitlist at Sydney Dental Hospital. Patients have previously been screened and determined as requiring orthodontic treatment for Class II malocclusion. Allocation is not concealed.
trial_design.sequence: list generated randomly from computerised waiting list.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to assess a new orthodontic appliance which moves the lower jaw forward in a stepwise fashion. It is intended that the orthodontic appliance will be more comfortable than other appliances as it is less bulky and will result in a better physiological response because of the stepwise advancement of the lower jaw.
